intro: Conostylis wonganensis, commonly known as the Wongan plains conostylis, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. This species is characterized by its tufted growth habit and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for local wildlife.
